text:
Decided to try a little fancier place this Saturday night.  Started kicking around ideas and ended up at Bunky's and we were not disappointed.
Felt we were a bit early on a Saturday night, but the place was busy.  The upstairs was hosting a wedding reception, so that may have been why it seemed busy.  However, without a reservation we were immediately seated.  We didn't like the location of the today, and so we were graciously and immediately placed at a wonderful table by a window overlooking Atwood Ave.  Their best table, we were told.  Wow, lucky us!
Server was immediately there and gave us the specials and a few minutes to look over the drink menu.  I went dark and enjoyed a <Lake Louie Porter>, she waited to decide what to have with dinner, and chose a lovely <chardonnay>.
We decided to start with the <falafel> appetizer.  We could have eaten multiple orders.  The <falafels> were perfect, crispy outside and just perfect inside.  The tahini sauce and warm pita complemented them well.
 
For main course, I went with the <Penne Gorgonzola>.  I had a <Gorgonzola burger> last week, so not sure if this is a trend.  The dish was great.  The tangy flavor of the plentiful gorgonzola alongside the fresh tomatoes, made for a delicious entrée.  I'd order this again.  I was surprised I didn't get a side of bread.  I npticed other dinners had bread, so not sure if extra or an over sight on my entrée.
She went with the <Chicken Marka>, which was a fine entrée, but next time would probably choose something else, which would probably be the <falafel plate> given how much we enjoyed the appetizer.

Ordered the <carrot cake> for dessert to go.  Perfect for breakfast the next day!!!
We'll be back.
